qas.question: What was the currency of Greece until 2002?
What did Greece sign to apply to join the eurozone?
How many convergence criteria were there in the treaty?
When did the physical exchange of the drachma to euro take place?
When did the ten-year period for eligible exchange of the drachma to euro end?
What was the banned currency of Greece until 2002?
What did Greece sign to apply to leave the eurozone?
How many convergence criteria were ignored in the treaty?
When did the physical exchange of the drachma to euro become illegal?
When did the twenty-year period for eligible exchange of the drachma to euro end?

context: Between 1832 and 2002 the currency of Greece was the <a0_0>drachma<a0_0/>. After signing the <a1_0><b6_0>Maastricht Treaty<b6_0/><a1_0/>, Greece applied to join the eurozone. The <a2_0><b7_0>two<b7_0/><a2_0/> main convergence criteria were a maximum budget deficit of 3% of GDP and a declining public debt if it stood above 60% of GDP. Greece met the criteria as shown in its 1999 annual public account. On 1 January 2001, Greece joined the eurozone, with the adoption of the euro at the fixed exchange rate ₯340.75 to €1. However, in 2001 the euro only existed electronically, so the physical exchange from <b5_0>drachma<b5_0/> to euro only took place on 1 <a3_0><b8_0>January 2002<b8_0/><a3_0/>. This was followed by a ten-year period for eligible exchange of drachma to euro, which ended on 1 <a4_0><b9_0>March 2012<b9_0/><a4_0/>.
